name: THEA 165
title: Dance Modernism
description: An overview of 20th-century dance within the perspective of modernism. Topics may include romanticism, "natural" dance, Orientalism, Ausdruckstanz, U.S. modern dance and neo-classicism, chance procedure, postmodernism, the avant-garde commodity marketplace, and critical dance cultures. Discussions may be supplemented by a movement practice component.
class_notes: This course provides an overview on 20th century modern dance in the United States and India. We will examine the work of selected modern dance artists through the lenses of Orientalism, gender, sexuality, race, nationalism, and transnationalism. This is a hybrid theory/practice course, whereby we engage critically with course material through analytical writing/discussion and artistic interventions.
